Key Match Events: Brad Evans c Afif Hossain b Mosaddek Hossain 2 (2b 0x4 0x6 5m)
Richard Ngarava st â€ Nurul Hasan b Mosaddek Hossain 6 (3b 0x4 1x6 6m)
Pre-Game Insights: Zimbabwe have grown to be a fighting side in the last few years, culminating in their ODI and T20I series wins over Bangladesh in July 2022.
Shakib Al Hasan's bowling form is a concern.
Zimbabwe's form is as good as their fighting spirit, and the way they defended the 130 against Pakistan was proof.
Bangladesh, meanwhile, are back in trouble in T20Is.
There's little doubt that this has been Raza's year in Zimbabwe colours, but Luke Jongwe has been the perfect foil.
Shakib Al Hasan is in great nick with the bat, having scored three half-centuries this year.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Teams batting first have won four out of the six T20Is in Brisbane, with 168 being the average first-innings score.
No problems on the weather front on match day.
In July, Zimbabwe beat Bangladesh in a T20I series for the first time.
Raza has won three Player-of-the-Match awards during this T20 World Cup, after not winning any in the 2014 and 2016 editions.
Others: Bangladesh technical consultant Sridharan Sriram, when asked how his side will stop Zimbabwe said: 'I don't think I need to tell you but we definitely have a plan. I think we respect Zimbabwe, they had an amazing performance against Pakistan. I watched every ball of it. The way they pulled it off against Pakistan was unbelievable. Full credit to them, full respect.'
